::Battera::

"Would it help if I agreed with you?" she looked at him with the fear 
and pain in hr eyes showing through.
"In understand why you hate me.  I can't blame you." she whispered, 
"I hate me too."
She walked past him and down the hall.
"I heard a Maximal say it once. A good Pred is a dead Pred. Maybe he 
was right?" she said walking away from him.  She didn't have anger or 
malace in her voice. But she couldn't help but think that maybe this 
maximal thought the same way about her, that she would be good when 
she was dead.


--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, Yanshosh@a... wrote:
> ::Rex::
> 
> Rex shruggs at Battera's story. "Typical Predacon behavior. You 
have nothing 
> to be ashamed off."
> 
> He blinks, realizing that she had been nice to him before, and he 
should 
> probably return the favor. It had been a long time since he had 
been 
> intentionally nice.
> 
> "I'm sorry about your friends though. But a few Preds down is never 
bad," he 
> says, the last sentence coming out before he knew what he was 
saying.
